Column Comment.0: UNIQUE WELL IDENTIFIER: A unique name, code or number designated as theprimary key for this row.
Column Comment.1: BUSINESS ASSOCIATE: unique identifier for the business associate who did theservice.
Column Comment.2: SERVICE SEQUENCE NUMBER: unique number assiged to this instance of theservice. Note that the use of the SEQ_NO domain indicates that order or sequencemay be implied by this sequence.
Column Comment.3: ACTIVE INDICATOR: A Y/N flag indicating whether this row of data is currently eitheractive / valid (Y) or inactive / invalid (N).
Column Comment.4: CONTACT BUSINESS ASSOCIATE: the identifier for the business associate who isthe contact for this service.
Column Comment.5: CONTRACT ID: Unique identifier for the contract table.
Column Comment.6: DESCRIPTION: General description of the service.
Column Comment.7: EFFECTIVE DATE: The date that the data in this row first came into effect.
Column Comment.8: END DATE: the date that this service was completed.
Column Comment.9: EXPIRY DATE: The date that the data in this row was no longer active or in effect.
Column Comment.10: ROW_MANAGEMENT_GUID: This value may be used to provide a global uniqueidentifier for this row of data. Use of this column is not mandatory, but if used,optional PPDM NOT NULL and UNIQUE INDEX constraints provided in the datamodel DDL should be created.
Column Comment.11: PROVIDED FOR BUSINESS ASSOCIATE: the identifier for the business associatefor whom the service was provided.
Column Comment.12: PROVISION IDENTIFIER: Unique identifier for the provision in a contract.
Column Comment.13: RATE OR FEE SCHEDULE: A schedule for payments as set up by a businessassociate such as a service provider, jurisdiction or regulatory agency. Feeschedules are often used to administer the rates for rentals or for services provided. .
Column Comment.14: REMARK: General remarks about the service provided.
Column Comment.15: REPRESENTED BUSINESS ASSOCIATE IDENTIFIER: Unique identifier for thebusiness associate who was represented by the company who did the work. Usuallyused for sub contracted work.
Column Comment.16: SERVICE DATE: the date that the service provided was completed.
Column Comment.17: SERVICE PERIOD: the period of time spent on this service, usually as hours to bebilled.
Column Comment.19: SERVICE QUALITY: the quality of service received for the work that was done.
Column Comment.20: SERVICE TIME: The time that this service was period, as clock time.
Column Comment.21: TIMEZONE: a valid list of time zones. You can obtain a list of timezones fromwww.worldtimezone.com.
Column Comment.22: SERVICE TIME DESC: A short textual description of the service time, such as earlyafternoon, lunch time, nap time, shift change.
Column Comment.23: BUSINESS ASSOCIATE SERVICE TYPE: A valid list of services for a businessassociate. For example well logger, drilling contractor, application developer. Forland, may be may be address for service, brokerage, maintainor etc.
Column Comment.24: SOURCE: The individual, company, state, or government agency designated as thesource of information for this row.
Column Comment.25: START DATE: The date that this service was started.
Column Comment.26: WELL ACTIVITY OBSERVATION NUMBER: Unique number for a well activity.
Column Comment.27: WELL ACTIVITY SOURCE: Unique identifier for the source of well activityinformation.
Column Comment.28: WELL DRILLING PERIOD OBSERVATION NUMBER: unique identifier for areporting period for well operations. Internationally, there may be 1, 2 or 3 periodseach 24 hours. In some jurisdictions, reporting may occur for more than one period,such as for an 8 hour tour shift and a 24 daily summary.
Column Comment.29: ROW CHANGED BY: Application login id of the user who last changed the row.
Column Comment.30: ROW CHANGED DATE: System date of the last time the row was changed.
Column Comment.31: ROW CREATED BY: System user who created this row of data.
Column Comment.32: ROW CREATED DATE: Date that the row was created on.
Column Comment.33: ROW_EFFECTIVE_DATE: A system assigned date that specified when a row of datais effective from a systems perspective. This may be the date that a row of data wasmade available to end users, for example.
Column Comment.34: ROW_EXPIRY_DATE: A system assigned date that specified when a row of data isno longer effective from a systems perspective. This may be the date that a row ofdata was no longer available to end users, for example.
Column Comment.35: PPDM ROW QUALITY: A set of values indicating the quality of data in this row,usually with reference to the method or procedures used to load the data, althoughother types of quality reference are permitted.
